DNASampleLocation.subject: MY.DNASampleLocation

enumNames: Number of breeding sites (rocks, cavities, etc.)
abundanceUnit.subject: MY.abundanceUnit
abundanceUnit.title: Abundance unit

additionalIDs.subject: MY.additionalIDs
additionalIDs.description: Other identifiers this specimen has, in format 'type:identifier'. For example: 'mzhtypes:123' (old MAZ-type number)
additionalIDs.title: Additional ID's

age.subject: MY.age
age.description: Estimated or known age in calendar years, years, days or other relevant unit.
age.title: Age

ageNotes.subject: MY.ageNotes
ageNotes.description: E.g. how age was determined, by whom and when.
ageNotes.title: Age notes

enumNames: 1 Unlikely breeding; Observed an individual of the species during the breeding season, but the observation does not suggest breeding in the respective atlas square

2 Possible breeding; Observed a single bird in one day (e.g. singing or displaying male, observed female) in the breeding season in a possible nesting habitat of the species, and breeding of the species in the atlas square is possible. Either the place was visited only once, or the bird was observed only once despite several visits.
3 Possible breeding; Observed a pair in one day in the breeding season in a possible nesting habitat, and breeding of the species in the atlas square is possible
4 Probable breeding; Observed a singing, displaying, or otherwise persistently staying male in the same place (i.e. on a permanent territory) on at least two days in the same breeding season
5 Probable breeding; Observed a female or a pair staying in the same place on at least two days in the same breeding season
6 Probable breeding; Observed a bird or pair in the breeding season in a manner strongly suggesting breeding
61 Probable breeding; A bird or a pair frequently visits a probable nesting site (e.g. regularly lands in the same reed bed or island)
62 Probable breeding; A bird or a pair builds a nest (digs or excavates a nest hole, carries nesting material, etc.)
63 Probable breeding; A bird or a pair gives warning calls because the nest or brood is apparently nearby
64 Probable breeding; A bird or a pair performs injury feigning such as broken-wing display or otherwise attempts to distract the observer away apparently from the nest or brood
65 Probable breeding; A bird or a pair dive-bombs or behaves otherwise threateningly toward the observer (e.g. owls and terns) because the nest or brood is apparently nearby
66 Probable breeding: Seen a nest with fresh nesting material (e.g. decorated nests of raptors) or food remains; however, no definite proof of eggs or chicks.
7 Confirmed breeding; Observed indirect evidence of confirmed breeding
71 Confirmed breeding; Seen used nest with eggs or eggshells, dead brood or remains of chicks, “dandruff” from feather sheaths etc., indicating that breeding occurred in the same year

72 Confirmed breeding; Observed a bird entering or leaving a nest in a way that clearly indicates breeding (although eggs or chicks have not been seen or chicks not heard, e.g. high nests or nest holes)
73 Confirmed breeding; Observed recently fledged young (nidicolous species) or downy young (nidifugous species) that can be considered born within the atlas square
74 Confirmed breeding; Observed an adult carrying or transporting food for young or a faecal sac, and the nest can be considered situating within the atlas square
75 Confirmed breeding; Adult seen incubating in the nest
8 Confirmed breeding; Observed direct evidence of confirmed breeding
81 Confirmed breeding; Direct evidence of a verified breeding detected: Nest with young heard (e.g. high nests or nest holes).
82 Confirmed breeding; Direct evidence of a verified breeding detected: Seen eggs or living young in the nest.
atlasCode.subject: MY.atlasCode
atlasCode.title: Breeding index

causeOfDeath.subject: MY.causeOfDeath
causeOfDeath.description: Cause of death, if not intentionally trapped on sampled
causeOfDeath.title: Cause of Death

chemistry.subject: MY.chemistry
chemistry.description: Results of chemical reaction tests etc.
chemistry.title: Chemical properties

count.subject: MY.count
count.description: Numeric or other description on the amount of individuals (or sprouts, fruiting bodies or such) in the specimen. Sexes and juveniles can be specified like so: 1m2f3j (=1 male, 2 females, 3 juveniles)
count.title: Count

decayStage.subject: MY.decayStage

enumNames: Herb-rich forest with broadleaved deciduous trees
Mountain birch forest (excluding herb-rich mountain birch forest)
Graminoid dwarf shrub rock outcrop and scree
Rock outcrop and scree deficient of trees
Calcareous rock outcrop and quarry, bare calcareous land
Rural biotopes and cultural habitats or other human-impacted environment
White dune (shifting dune with lyme grass)
Grey dune (fixed coastal dune with herbaceus vegetation)
Brown dune (fixed coastal dune with crowberry)
Siliceous weathered rock or rapakivi granite
Mountain oligotrophic and mesotrophic flat bedrock outcrop
Mountain calcareous bedrock outcrop or boulder field
Mountain serpentine rock outcrop or boulder field

enumNames: E - spreading in the wild, cultivated origin
TE - alien, spreading in the wild, cultivated origin
TVE - alien, resident, spreading in the wild, cultivated origin
TOVE - alien, old, resident (archaeotype), cultivated origin
TNVE - alien, new, resident, cultivated origin
TNSE - alien, new, ephemeral, cultivated origin
H - short distance escape from cultivation (inside a garden or similar)

additionalIDs.subject: MF.additionalIDs
additionalIDs.description: Other identifiers this preparation/sample has, in format 'type:identifier'. For example: 'MZHtissue:123'. You can enter the type and colon and then click 'generate' to fetch the next free number for that prefix type.

bold.subject: MF.bold
bold.description: BOLD ID (usually BOLD "Sample ID") for the preparation/sample. If no other preparation/sample information is entered, use the BOLD field on the document level
bold.title: Sample BOLD ID

collectionID.subject: MF.collectionID
collectionID.description: The collection which this preparation/sample belongs to, if different from the collection of the specimen.
collectionID.title: Preparation/sample collection

condition.subject: MF.condition
condition.description: Notes on the defects of the preparation/sample (missing parts or such). For specimen level status use the condition field in the basic information section (document level). Empty value means same as "good" or "hyvä" - that the sample is in fine condition.
condition.title: Preparation/sample condition (defects)

datasetID.subject: MF.datasetID
datasetID.description: Tag for the preparation/sample. For specimen level tags, use the tag field in the basic information section (document level).
datasetID.title: Preparation/sample tag(s)

event.subject: MF.event

genbank.subject: MF.genbank

individualsInPreparation.subject: MF.individualsInPreparation
individualsInPreparation.description: For example a jar that contains multiple fish individuals can be recorded as one specimen and one preparation. Can also be used for DNA samples (was DNA extracted from single or multiple individuals?).
individualsInPreparation.title: Single/multiple individual(s)?

material.subject: MF.material
material.description: Preparation/sample material. Choose preparation/sample type first.

preparationDate.subject: MF.preparationDate

preparationMaterials.subject: MF.preparationMaterials
preparationMaterials.description: Materials (chemicals, kits etc.) used in the preparation process. It is possible to choose several.
preparationMaterials.title: Preparation process materials

preparationProcess.subject: MF.preparationProcess

preparationProcess.title: Preparation process

preparationProcessNotes.subject: MF.preparationProcessNotes
preparationProcessNotes.description: Additional information about the preparation process.
preparationProcessNotes.title: Preparation process notes

preparedBy.subject: MF.preparedBy
preparedBy.description: Name of the person who prepared the preparation/sample, preferably in the format 'lastname, firstname'
preparedBy.title: Prepared by

isPartOf.subject: MY.isPartOf
isPartOf.description: Which parent or larger collection this is part of.
isPartOf.title: Is part of

preservation.subject: MF.preservation
preservation.description: Preservation methods and materials of the preparation/sample. It is possible to choose several
preservation.title: Preparation/sample preservation

publication.subject: MF.publication
publication.description: Publication references or doi's that refer to this preparations/sample. For publications referring to the specimen, use publications field in the Other section (document level).
publication.title: Preparation/sample publication(s)

quality.subject: MF.quality

qualityNotes.subject: MF.qualityNotes

sampleLocation.subject: MF.sampleLocation
